messages.message: Good morning All, can we add some helper classes to the notebooks so we can read the ibmsg files?

+1

This was a pain to work with. i ended up using proto-inspector + an indent based parser.
I think you can already do this; you can read an ibmsg the same way as you read a ibdoc. @Naveen - any input here?
To be fair I needed to read these files locally and couldn't get the IB repo set up in time. Hence the work around :shrug:
thanks @Kerry appreciate the quick response. Everything I have seen seems to rely on the ibdoc being in the json format so will wait for @Naveen to weigh in
let us provide an example notebook

So we don’t actually include any internal files in notebook, we only expose the public-libs to keep notebooks Infra independent (since notebook can be deployed outside cluster as well). Usually we interact with platform using APIs/public-libs.
IBOCR is JSON format that can be directly read by notebook.
For IBDoc/IBMsg, we may need to use the preview API of platform to convert them to json to read them. (Similar to how you open IBDoc/IBMsg in text editor).
ah ok, my bad. so @Will this is not doable now, but this is a good feature request. i’ll open a ticket to track this
appreciate it @Kerry! Thanks for the clarification @Naveen
